subject: NOR
title: Beginning Norwegian
info: emphasis on working toward novice-intermediate low proficiency in all four language modalities (listening, reading, speaking, writing).  topics include everyday subjects (shopping, directions, family, food, housing, etc.).

subject: NOR
title: Beginning Norwegian
info: continues the presentation of all four language modalities (listening, reading, speaking, writing) with a proficiency emphasis. topics include free-time activities, careers, and norwegian culture.

subject: NOR
title: Intermediate Norwegian
info: emphasis on intermediate proficiency in listening, reading, speaking, and writing. contextualized work on grammar and vocabulary is combined with authentic readings and essay assignments.

subject: NOR
title: Intermediate Norwegian
info: emphasis on developing intermediate mid-high proficiency in listening, reading, speaking, and writing. contextualized work on grammar and vocabulary is supported by work with authentic readings and essay assignments.

subject: NOR
title: Online Basic Norwegian
info: norwegian language/culture. travel, weather, family, work, school, daily life. students meet for orientation and midterm, then work at own pace using multi-media web curriculum. instructor-student interactions through e-mail, threaded discussions, and audio messages.

subject: NOR
title: Advanced Norwegian
info: fiction, film, journalistic, and professional prose. grammar, vocabulary building exercises, systematic review of oral/written modes of communication.

subject: NOR
title: Advanced Norwegian
info: novels, short stories, plays, articles. structural, stylistic, and vocabulary-building exercises.

subject: NOR
title: Beg Norwegian Grad Research
info: emphasis on working toward novice-intermediate low proficiency in all four language modalities (listening, reading, speaking, writing). topics include everyday subjects (shopping, directions, family, food, housing, etc.). meets concurrently with 1001.

subject: NOR
title: Beg Norwegian Grad Research
info: continues the presentation of all four language modalities (listening, reading, speaking, writing) with a proficiency emphasis. topics include free-time activities, careers, and norwegian culture. meets concurrently with 1002.

subject: NOR
title: Int Norwegian Grad Research
info: emphasis on intermediate proficiency in listening, reading, speaking, and writing. contextualized work on grammar and vocabulary is combined with authentic readings and essay assignments. meets concurrently with 1003.

subject: NOR
title: Int Norwegian Grad Research
info: emphasis on developing intermediate mid-high proficiency in listening, reading, speaking, and writing. contextualized work on grammar and vocabulary is supported by work with authentic readings and essay assignments. meets concurrently with 1004.
prereqInfo: 1004 in another language or passing score on lpe or grad student
